description: With things having quieted down a bit for the Guardians, they can now focus on things besides fending off the peril of the evil Easter Corporation. Amu is having some troubles deciding which guy she likes the most, and hiding Ikuto in her room. Not only does the Embryo still elude the Guardians, and worries of Easter being suspiciously inactive, the threat of a new X Egg appears...

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Shoujo
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult females.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: School Club
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a school club scene.

tags.name: Nekomimi
tags.description: Humanoid characters with cat-like features such as cat ears and a tail.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Fairy Tale
tags.description: This work tells a fairy tale, centers around fairy tales, or is based on a classic fairy tale.

tags.name: Homeless
tags.description: Prominently features a character that is homeless.

tags.name: Estranged Family
tags.description: At least one family member of the MC intentionally distances themselves or a family distances themselves from a person related to the MC.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Idol
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of an idol.

tags.name: Fashion
tags.description: Centers around the fashion industry.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Family Life
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a family unit.

tags.name: Astronomy
tags.description: Relating or centered around the study of celestial objects and phenomena, space, or the universe.

tags.name: Rehabilitation
tags.description: Prominently features the recovery of a character who became incapable of social life or work.

tags.name: Tomboy
tags.description: Features a girl who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of boys.

node.description:
__Height:__ 159 cm
__Agency:__ I'm Enterprise

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/rie_k_0530) | [Profile (I'm Enterprise)](https://www.imenterprise.jp/profile.php?id=52) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/kugimiyarie-blog/) | [Lantis Music](https://www.lantis.jp/artist/kugimiyarie/)

**Non-Anime Roles:**
- Irene - Arknights (VG)
- Unknown God - Genshin Impact (VG)
- Kiana Kaslana - Honkai Impact 3rd (VG)
- Luna - Punishing: Gray Raven (VG)
- Vesti - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- iDoll Ocean - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Haruka Sawamura - Yakuza Series (VG)
- Vena - TEVI (VG)
- Fukayama Ayane - Nogizaka Haruka no Himitsu: Cosplay, Hajimemashita (VN)

__Height:__ 153 cm 

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/NM_NANAPARTY) | [Website](https://www.mizukinana.jp/) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/user/mizukinanaKING) | [Instagram](https://instagram.com/nanamizuki_nm7)

She is admired by many of her fellow actors and fans because of the fact that she has a great amount of power and strength in her singing voice, which surprises many fans due to her regularly petite stature. She was also the winner of the "Best Musical Performance" award in the first Seiyuu Awards. She was also part of the quartet Prits alongside Yumiko Kobayashi, Natsuko Kuwatani, and Hisayo Mochizuki (all four voiced characters in the anime _Sister Princess_). Her singing style comes from singing Enka since she was young.

In July 2020, she married someone from the music industry, and they had their first child on March 16, 2021.

__Non-Anime Roles:__
- Ittasha in Bakuage Sentai Boonboomger

[Profile (Aoni)](https://www.aoni.co.jp/search/ito-kanae.html) | [Profile (Lantis)](https://www.lantis.jp/artist/itokanae/) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kanae_1126_ito) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/itokanae_info) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/ito-kanae/)

After graduating from high school, Kanae enrolled at the Amusement Media Academy, a vocational school for voice actors and artists, and graduated in 2007. Prior to graduating she was a member of two voice acting groups called Koetchi (こえっち) and Rirachitchi (りらちっち) before both groups disbanded in December 2005 and January 28, 2007 respectively.

Her first major role came in 2007 when she played the lead heroine, Amu Hinamori, from the anime Shugo Chara!. The show became a hit and Kanae was praised by critics. Since then, she has voiced Amu in other Shugo Chara! franchises including radio serials, drama CDs and video games.  

She and fellow voice actress Aki Toyosaki are good friends who worked together on several anime including Shugo Chara!, To Love-Ru, The World God Only Knows, Hanasaku Iroha and Toaru Kagaku no Railgun (both also hosted the Toaru Kagaku no Railgun web radio show, Radio no Railgun). 

She was also nominated for "Best Rookie Voice Actress," at the 4th Seiyuu Awards.  

In January 1st, 2024, she announced on both her blog and Twitter account that she got married to a man from outside the entertainment industry.

Non-Anime Roles:

Campanella - The Legend of Heroes Series (VG)

**Birth Name:** Kana Harada (原田佳奈)
**Height:** 161 cm

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/0812asumikana)

**Non-Anime Roles**
• Bronya Zaychik (Honkai Impact 3rd)
• Bronya Rand (Honkai: Star Rail)
• Silver Wolf (Honkai: Star Rail)

Peach-Pit is a female manga artist duo from Japan, made up of Banri Sendou (千道 万里) and Shibuko Ebara (えばら 渋子). Their group name derives from the diner hangout in the TV show Beverly Hills 90210. Although both have similar styles, with some artwork it is possible to identify which artist drew it. Both are known for their bishoujo styled works. As noted in their books, they are both Geminis and have "Almost flushed our phones down the toilet... twice."

The two of them grew up together and went to the same elementary school and have been best friends ever since. Both started as doujinshi manga artists, but not as Peach-Pit. Then they were scouted by Dengeki Comic Gao!.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/satojumichi) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/佐藤順一)

Junichi Satou is a Japanese anime director, best known for working on shoujo-based anime and in the magical girl genre. He was formerly associated with [TYO Animations](https://anilist.co/studio/333/), formerly known as [Hal Film Maker](https://anilist.co/studio/34/).

Satou’s first major work was directing the first, and a portion of the second season of [Sailor Moon](https://anilist.co/anime/530/) for [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/), after which he handed the position over to [Kunihiko Ikuhara](https://anilist.co/staff/100082/), although he continued to storyboard and direct episodes for the later seasons. Satou later went on to co-direct [Ojamajo Doremi](https://anilist.co/anime/350/) alongside [Takuya Igarashi](https://anilist.co/staff/105087/), as well as the critically acclaimed [Princess Tutu](https://anilist.co/anime/721/). Satou served as chief director for long-runner [Sgt. Frog](https://anilist.co/anime/516/), and in recent years has become more known for his iyashikei works such as [Aria](https://anilist.co/anime/477/) and [Tamayura](https://anilist.co/anime/9055/).

He's married to [Yasuno Satou](https://anilist.co/staff/144094/).

(Source: Wikipedia)

Buono! is a former Hello! Project unit consisting of three Hello! Project Kids members  Momoko Tsugunaga and Miyabi Natsuyaki from [Berryz Kobo](https://anilist.co/staff/100550/), and [Airi Suzuki](https://anilist.co/staff/165660) from [°C-ute](https://anilist.co/staff/100551/).  The unit was officially announced at the Nakayoshi magazine Festival 2007 on July 21, 2007, at Tokyo's Sunshine City in Ikebukuro, and formed to sing both the opening ("Kokoro no Tamago") and ending ("Honto no Jibun") themes for the anime adaptation of the Shugo Chara! manga.  On July 20, 2008, Anime News Network officially stated that the unit will continue recording for a second year. The group only did the ending themes for the second Shugo Chara! series ("Shugo Chara! Doki").

Shugo Chara Egg! is a Hello! Project unit consisting of four Hello! Pro Egg members. Maeda Yuuka (Amulet Heart), Saho Akari (Amulet Spade), Fukuda Kanon (Amulet Clover), and Wada Ayaka (Amulet Diamond).  

The unit was formed to sing some of the new opening themes for the second season of the anime adaptation of the Shugo Chara! manga. (Shugo Chara! Doki)  It was revealed in Nakayoshi Magazine that Shugo Chara Egg! would return for the third Shugo Chara! series ("Shugo Chara Party!"), with a new lineup. They will act as hosts in live action segments on the show, and sing the opening theme for the anime segment ("Shugo Chara! Dokki Doki") of the program.  

The new lineup consists of three Hello! Pro Egg members (one of which was in the first lineup).  The new lineup is: Saho Akari (Amulet Spade), Fukumura Mizuki (Amulet Heart), Maeda Irori (Amulet Clover); Tanabe Nanami has been chosen through Amulet Diamond Audition to be the fourth member of the group.

Guardians 4 (ガーディアンズ4) was a Hello! Project unit put together to sing new opening themes for the anime Shugo Chara!! Doki. The unit consists of Aika Mitsui (光井愛佳) of [Morning Musume](https://anilist.co/staff/150336/), Yurina Kumai (熊井友理奈) and [Sugaya Risako](https://anilist.co/staff/107143/) (菅谷梨沙子) of [Berryz Koubou](https://anilist.co/staff/100550/), and  Nakajima Saki (中島早貴) of [°C-ute](https://anilist.co/staff/100551/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/oitan125) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/花田十輝)

Jukki Hanada is a Japanese screenwriter and novelist. He is the grandson of literary critic and essayist Kiyoteru Hanada. He formerly belonged to [Takao Koyama's](https://anilist.co/staff/117575/Takao-Koyama) Brother Noppo anime scenario house. He's currently affiliated with SATZ.

He's a big fan of professional baseball and supports the Hiroshima Toyo Carp.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/931752627359977472)

Currently mainly active at [Trigger](https://anilist.co/studio/803/).

Yoshigaki joined [Gainax](https://anilist.co/studio/6/) after graduating from Yoyogi Animation School. There he immediately got along with fellow animator [Hiroyuki Imaishi](https://anilist.co/staff/97349/), who joined the studio at the same time. Imaishi says that Yoshigaki is the "ideal animator."

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/98020267)

Yamada graduated from the Department of Literature at Keio University. While attending the university he was in the same year as the Macross character designer [Haruhiko Mikimoto](https://anilist.co/staff/96968/) and creator [Shouji Kawamori](https://anilist.co/staff/97501/), both of which where the first people he collaborated with in [The Super Dimension Fortress Macross](https://anilist.co/anime/1088//). This marked the start of his scriptwriting career.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/98020267)

Yamada graduated from the Department of Literature at Keio University. While attending the university he was in the same year as the Macross character designer [Haruhiko Mikimoto](https://anilist.co/staff/96968/) and creator [Shouji Kawamori](https://anilist.co/staff/97501/), both of which where the first people he collaborated with in [The Super Dimension Fortress Macross](https://anilist.co/anime/1088//). This marked the start of his scriptwriting career.

__Susumu Aketagawa__ is a Japanese sound director and the representative director of Magic Capsule. His son, [Jin Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/103074), is also a sound director working at Magic Capsule.
